page.title: 20A SUMMARY
page.content: Our area is situated North of Bognor Regis.Barnham has become increasingly more popular.Barnham railway station is a major junction for trains from London and the South Coast.The area consists of mainly very flat farmland.St.Philip Howard High School is becoming very popular with an increasing number of pupils.Also in the area are two primary schools called Barnham and Aldingbourne Junior.There are two main historic monuments here.St.Mary's Church which is about 900 years old.The old canal was built in 1840 but was unused due to the construction of the railway.Other features include 8 nurseries,3 caravan parks and 2 pig farms.The Water works is situated South of the canal and the sewage works south of Westergate. By Heather Sampford.
